author: Melonslice115
text:
But don't you see how this will never get us anywhere? If  everyone gets to use "acknowledgement of hypocrisy" as an argument every debate will just go round in circles.

Person 1:"Qatar exploited migrant workers and that's bad, let's have a discussion to prevent this from happening again in the future"

Person 2:"Well what about the west's reliance on cheap products produced abroad (often in Asian countries like China) by exploited workers? Isn't that bad too and need to be addressed?"

Person 1:"What about China's mistreatment of migrant workers in the construction industry?"

In this example two people have made several valid points, and brought up several valid issues that need addressing, but the conversation hasn't actually achieved anything. Just constant shifting of blame and responsibility doesn't do anyone any good.

So next time someone brings up an issue either try to justify why you believe it is not an issue, or agree that it is an issue and explain why.

If you would then like to bring up a separate issue after that debate is complete that is fine, and I think you'll find people will be far more likely to agree with you and engage in a propper debate.
